feed.title: inblock.io Updates
feed.description: Latest news on digital sovereignty, the Aqua Protocol, and trust infrastructure from inblock.io.

entries.title: inblock.io Pivots to AI-First Trust Infrastructure
entries.summary: inblock.io announces a strategic pivot to serve the AI space first with its trust infrastructure. Aqua Protocol V4 addresses the AI security gap with verifiable agent identity, granular access control, and tamper-proof provenance for autonomous systems operating at scale.
keyFacts: inblock.io is reorienting its trust infrastructure to prioritize AI agent identity, access control, and provenance.
Aqua Protocol V4 delivers four AI-first capabilities: portable hash-chains, modular signatures, immutable timestamps, and flexible trust models.
The pivot aligns with EU AI Act (penalties up to 7% global turnover) and US NTIA provenance technology recommendations.
All products — AquaFire, Aqua JS SDK, and consulting — will prioritize AI integration use cases.
Trust is built on mathematics, not authority: verifiable identity, provable provenance, and auditable access, all open-source.

entries.title: inblock.io Adopts the AI Discovery Standard
entries.summary: inblock.io implements all three tiers of the AI Discovery Standard proposed by Rootz, serving verified organizational data at /.well-known/ai for AI agents. The standard aligns with the Aqua Protocol's mission of building verifiable trust infrastructure.
keyFacts: inblock.io now serves a /.well-known/ai endpoint with structured, machine-readable organizational data for AI agents.
All three tiers implemented: Discovery (/.well-known/ai), Knowledge (/ai/knowledge.json), and Feed (/ai/feed.json).
The AI Discovery Standard complements Aqua Protocol by providing a standardized identity layer that cryptographic verification can extend.
The standard is open (CC-BY-4.0), free, and vendor-neutral with an IANA registration in preparation.

entries.title: China Recognizes Data as a Balance Sheet Asset
entries.summary: China now allows companies to formally record high-quality data on their balance sheets as intangible assets or inventory. This regulatory shift validates the strategic importance of data governance and aligns with what the Aqua Protocol enables.
keyFacts: Chinese regulators allow enterprises to account for data resources as intangible assets or inventory on balance sheets.
Only about 2% of firms reported data assets in 2024, indicating early-stage adoption with significant growth potential.
Aqua Protocol supports this transition by providing decentralized, verifiable data chains for auditable data assets.
Verifiable data provenance and integrity become competitive advantages as accounting standards evolve globally.

entries.title: Defining Data Accounting
entries.summary: CEO Tim Bansemer introduces data accounting as a discipline: systematically ensuring data integrity and history by linking it to secure digital identities using cryptographic hashing, signing, and timestamping. A three-dimensional framework of Data, Account, and Time forms the foundation, implemented in the Aqua Protocol.
keyFacts: Data accounting is the systematic process of ensuring data integrity via cryptographic hashing, public key signing, and timestamping.
The framework defines three namespaces: Data (content hashes), Account (public keys for identity), and Time (cryptographic timestamps).
Blockchains demonstrate fully accounted systems but remain impractical for general data accounting due to scalability and privacy constraints.
The Aqua Protocol implements this framework, deployed on Ethereum since April 2021, supporting identity, access control, and document authentication.

entries.title: Launching Aqua Guardian
entries.summary: Aqua Guardian is an open-source component providing secure, permissioned access to Aqua Chains. Developed in collaboration with TU Ilmenau and nominated for a university software prize, it uses Sign-In with Ethereum (SIWE) authentication, Data Access Agreements, and challenge-proof mechanisms for fine-grained, cryptographically secured access control.
keyFacts: Aqua Guardian provides permissioned access to Aqua Chains with signature-based controls embedded in the protocol.
Developed with TU Ilmenau as part of Softwareprojekt 12, nominated for second prize in the university competition.
Uses SIWE authentication, Data Access Agreements, and challenge-proof mechanisms for decentralized access control.
Supports dynamic updates, file streaming, and service discovery aligned with GAIA-X and International Data Spaces standards.

entries.title: Aqua Offline Verifier
entries.summary: A web service for verifying aqua.json files offline, providing the same output as the Chrome Extension without requiring installation. Privacy-first trust verification accessible from any browser.
keyFacts: Web-based verification service for aqua.json files without requiring browser extension installation.
Provides identical verification output to the Aqua Chrome Extension.
Enables privacy-first, offline-capable trust verification from any browser.
